CatDescriptText: Mr. George Powell, chauffeur, Avis Rental Service, 270 Bonifay Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?"  Answer reads: "In my opinion, the past years have shown that by sitting down we haven't gained too much. As far as I've seen, the militant stands have accomplished more than just sitting down and doing nothing.  Therefore I'm in favor of a militant stand the way in which we gain the most progress."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Powell wearing cap with "Avis rent-a-car" patch, standing in front of store window with wreath
